page.title: 01Keinton Mandeville and Area
page.content: The small Somerset village of Keinton Mandeville lies in an area of gently rolling hills. The soils are heavy and mixed farming predominates with the emphasis on arable. The school boarding house at Kingweston is an important feature of the block and of the wider local area. Most of the population commute into nearby Yeovil for work, as few are employed on the land or in providing local services. If more services are needed, Somerton or Yeovil have to be reached. Therefore car ownership is high. The stone quarries to the north of Keinton Mandeville, although disused, were the source of building stone, for a large number of local buildings. The block has small villages set against an agricultural background.
